drive.network.filters.filter module#

class drive.network.filters.filter.IbdFilter(ibd_file: ~typing.Iterator[~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame], indices: ~drive.network.models.generate_indices.FileIndices, target_gene: ~drive.network.models.types.Genes, filter: ~typing.Callable | None = None, ibd_vs: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = <factory>, ibd_pd: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame = <factory>, hapid_map: ~typing.Dict[str, int] = <factory>, all_haplotypes: ~typing.List[str] = <factory>, haplotype_id: int = 0)[source]#

Bases: object

class handling the filtering of the IBD files provided

Parameters:

  • ibd_file (iterator[DataFrame]) â€“ pandas dataframe being read in chunk by chunk. This data represents the pairwise IBD segments from hap-IBD, GERMLINE, RaPID, or iLASH

  • indices (FileIndices) â€“ object that abstracts away the indices needed based on the IBD program used

  • target_gene (Genes) â€“ namedTuple that has fields for the chromosome and the start and end region of the target locus

  • filter (Optional[Callable] = None) â€“ Function that will be used to filter the provided segments. Default functions will either filter to segments containing the target locus or those that overlap

  • ibd_vs (DataFrame) â€“ dataframe representing all the potential vertices in the graph. Each vertex is a haplotype

  • ibd_pd (DataFrame) â€“ dataframe representing the pairwise segments. Each row is the pair ids and the length of the segment

  • hapid_map (Dict[str, int]) â€“ dictionary mapping the haplotype to a unique integer id

  • all_haplotypes (List[str]) â€“ list of all the different haplotypes in the IBD data

  • haplotype_id (int = 0) â€“ This value is used as the counter and is incremented as the program runs

classmethod load_file(ibd_file: Path, indices: FileIndices, target_gene: Genes) → T[source]#

Factory method that returns the IBDFilter model This method makes sure that the ibd file exists

Parameters:

  • ibd_file (Path) â€“ Path object containing the filepath for the ibd file from hapibd, iLASH, etcâ€¦

  • indices (FileIndices) â€“ Object that has all the indices for the necessary columns in the ibd file. This object also has a get_haplotype_ids method that will form the haplotype ibd.

  • target_gene (Genes) â€“ namedtuple that has attributes for the chromosome, the gene start position, and the gene end position.

Returns:

returns an initialized IbdFilter object

Return type:

IbdFilter

Raises:

FileNotFoundError â€“ raises an error if the file doesnâ€™t exist

preprocess(min_centimorgan: int, cohort_ids: List[str] | None = None) → None[source]#

Method that will filter the ibd file.

Parameters:

  • min_centimorgan (int) â€“ Minimum segment threshold that is used to filter the ibd file. Program only keeps segments that are greater than or equal to the threshold.

  • cohort_ids (List[str]) â€“ Lists of ids that make up the cohort. The ibd_file will be filtered to only this list.

set_filter(filter_option: str) → None[source]#

Method to determine how the user wishes to filter the IBD segments file

Parameters:

filter_option (str) â€“ string that represents the userâ€™s choice for how to filter the ibd segments. If the user chooses â€˜containsâ€™ the only segments that contain the entire region are kept. If the user chooses â€˜overlapsâ€™ then segments that overlap at all with the target region are kept.
